name: io.github.awslabs/log-analyzer-cloudwatch
title: Log Analyzer with CloudWatch Logs
description: Access AWS CloudWatch Logs for searching, analyzing, and correlating logs across services.

packageArguments.description: Specify the source for the uvx package
Git repository URL for the package source
Entry point command to start the MCP server

packageArguments.name: --profile
packageArguments.description: AWS profile name to use for credentials. Defaults to the default AWS profile if not specified.

packageArguments.name: --region
packageArguments.description: AWS region for CloudWatch Logs API calls (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1).

environmentVariables.name: AWS_PROFILE
environmentVariables.description: AWS profile to use for authentication. Alternative to the --profile argument.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_DEFAULT_REGION
environmentVariables.description: AWS default region for API calls (e.g., us-east-1). Used by boto3. Alternative to the --region argument.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
environmentVariables.description: AWS access key for programmatic authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
environmentVariables.description: AWS secret access key for programmatic authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
environmentVariables.description: AWS session token for temporary credential authentication.

name: io.github.crystaldba/postgres-mcp
title: PostgreSQL MCP Pro
description: PostgreSQL tuning and analysis with index tuning, explain plans, and health checks.

packageArguments.name: --access-mode
packageArguments.description: Database access mode. 'restricted' for read-only with resource limits (production), 'unrestricted' for full read/write (development).

environmentVariables.name: DATABASE_URI
environmentVariables.description: PostgreSQL connection URI, composed from PG_USER, PG_PASSWORD, PG_HOST, PG_PORT, and PG_DATABASE.

packageArguments.name: --access-mode
packageArguments.description: Database access mode. 'restricted' for read-only with resource limits (production), 'unrestricted' for full read/write (development).

environmentVariables.name: DATABASE_URI
environmentVariables.description: PostgreSQL connection URI, composed from PG_USER, PG_PASSWORD, PG_HOST, PG_PORT, and PG_DATABASE.

name: io.github.awslabs/aws-iac-mcp-server
title: AWS Infrastructure as Code
description: CloudFormation validation, compliance checking, CDK guidance, and deployment troubleshooting.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_PROFILE
environmentVariables.description: Named AWS CLI profile to use for authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_DEFAULT_REGION
environmentVariables.description: AWS region for API calls (e.g., us-east-1).

environmentVariables.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
environmentVariables.description: AWS access key for programmatic authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
environmentVariables.description: AWS secret access key for programmatic authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
environmentVariables.description: AWS session token for temporary credential authentication.

environmentVariables.name: FASTMCP_LOG_LEVEL
environmentVariables.description: Logging level for the FastMCP framework (e.g., ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG).

name: io.github.xing5/mcp-google-sheets
title: Google Sheets
description: Read, create, and modify Google Sheets spreadsheets via the Google Sheets and Drive APIs.

packageArguments.name: --include-tools
packageArguments.description: Comma-separated list of tool names to enable. Reduces context usage when only a subset of the 19 tools is needed.

environmentVariables.name: SERVICE_ACCOUNT_PATH
environmentVariables.description: Path to a Google Cloud Service Account JSON key file. Recommended for server/automation use.

environmentVariables.name: DRIVE_FOLDER_ID
environmentVariables.description: Google Drive folder ID to scope spreadsheet access. The service account must have access to this folder.

environmentVariables.name: CREDENTIALS_PATH
environmentVariables.description: Path to an OAuth 2.0 client credentials JSON file (for interactive/personal use).

environmentVariables.name: TOKEN_PATH
environmentVariables.description: Path to store the OAuth token file after authorization.

environmentVariables.name: CREDENTIALS_CONFIG
environmentVariables.description: Base64-encoded Google Cloud credential JSON. Alternative to file-based credential paths.

environmentVariables.name: ENABLED_TOOLS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of tool names to enable. Alternative to the --include-tools argument.

name: io.github.pulsemcp/playwright-stealth
title: Playwright Stealth
description: Browser automation with Playwright and optional stealth mode to bypass anti-bot protection.

environmentVariables.name: STEALTH_MODE
environmentVariables.description: Enable anti-detection measures to bypass bot protection.

environmentVariables.name: HEADLESS
environmentVariables.description: Run browser in headless mode (no visible window).

environmentVariables.name: TIMEOUT
environmentVariables.description: Default action timeout in milliseconds.

environmentVariables.name: NAVIGATION_TIMEOUT
environmentVariables.description: Page navigation timeout in milliseconds.

environmentVariables.name: SCREENSHOT_STORAGE_PATH
environmentVariables.description: Directory for storing screenshots.

environmentVariables.name: STEALTH_USER_AGENT
environmentVariables.description: Custom User-Agent string. Uses browser default if not set.

environmentVariables.name: STEALTH_MASK_LINUX
environmentVariables.description: Mask Linux as Windows in User-Agent string.

environmentVariables.name: STEALTH_LOCALE
environmentVariables.description: Custom locale for Accept-Language header.

environmentVariables.name: IGNORE_HTTPS_ERRORS
environmentVariables.description: Ignore HTTPS certificate errors.

environmentVariables.name: PROXY_URL
environmentVariables.description: Proxy server URL.

environmentVariables.name: PROXY_USERNAME
environmentVariables.description: Proxy authentication username.

environmentVariables.name: PROXY_PASSWORD
environmentVariables.description: Proxy authentication password.

environmentVariables.name: PROXY_BYPASS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of hosts to bypass the proxy.

environmentVariables.name: BROWSER_PERMISSIONS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of browser permissions to grant.

name: com.amazonaws/ecs-mcp
title: Amazon ECS
description: Read-only monitoring and troubleshooting for Amazon ECS deployments, tasks, logs, and networking.

packageArguments.description: ECS MCP server endpoint URL. Replace {region} with your AWS region (e.g., us-east-1).

packageArguments.name: --service
packageArguments.description: AWS service name for SigV4 signing.

packageArguments.name: --profile
packageArguments.description: AWS CLI profile name to use for credentials.

packageArguments.name: --region
packageArguments.description: AWS region for the ECS MCP server endpoint (e.g., us-east-1, us-west-2).

packageArguments.name: --read-only
packageArguments.description: Disable write-permission tools. The ECS MCP server is already read-only, so this is optional.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_PROFILE
environmentVariables.description: AWS CLI profile name. Alternative to the --profile argument.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_DEFAULT_REGION
environmentVariables.description: AWS region. Alternative to the --region argument.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
environmentVariables.description: AWS access key for programmatic authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
environmentVariables.description: AWS secret access key for programmatic authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
environmentVariables.description: AWS session token for temporary credential authentication.

name: io.github.pulsemcp/dynamodb
title: DynamoDB
description: AWS DynamoDB table and item operations with fine-grained tool and table-level access control.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_REGION
environmentVariables.description: AWS region for DynamoDB (e.g., us-east-1).

environmentVariables.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
environmentVariables.description: AWS access key for authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
environmentVariables.description: AWS secret access key for authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
environmentVariables.description: AWS session token for temporary credential authentication.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_PROFILE
environmentVariables.description: AWS CLI profile name. Alternative to explicit credentials.

environmentVariables.name: DYNAMODB_ENDPOINT
environmentVariables.description: Custom DynamoDB endpoint URL for local development (e.g., http://localhost:8000 for DynamoDB Local or LocalStack).

environmentVariables.name: DYNAMODB_ENABLED_TOOL_GROUPS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of tool groups to enable: readonly, readwrite, admin. Defaults to all groups.

environmentVariables.name: DYNAMODB_ENABLED_TOOLS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated whitelist of specific tool names to enable. Overrides ENABLED_TOOL_GROUPS and DISABLED_TOOLS.

environmentVariables.name: DYNAMODB_DISABLED_TOOLS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated blacklist of specific tool names to disable. Overridden by ENABLED_TOOLS.

environmentVariables.name: DYNAMODB_ALLOWED_TABLES
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of table names the server can access. All other tables are denied. If unset, all tables are accessible.

environmentVariables.name: SKIP_HEALTH_CHECKS
environmentVariables.description: Skip startup health checks that verify DynamoDB connectivity.

name: io.github.pulsemcp/s3
title: AWS S3
description: S3 bucket and object operations with fine-grained tool access control and single-bucket mode.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
environmentVariables.description: AWS access key for authenticating S3 API calls.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
environmentVariables.description: AWS secret access key for authenticating S3 API calls.

environmentVariables.name: AWS_REGION
environmentVariables.description: AWS region for S3 operations (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1).

environmentVariables.name: AWS_ENDPOINT_URL
environmentVariables.description: Custom S3-compatible endpoint URL. Use for MinIO, LocalStack, or other S3-compatible services.

environmentVariables.name: S3_BUCKET
environmentVariables.description: Constrain all operations to a single bucket. When set, bucket-level tools are hidden and the bucket parameter is auto-injected into object-level tools.

environmentVariables.name: S3_ENABLED_TOOLGROUPS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of tool groups to enable: 'readonly' (list_buckets, list_objects, get_object, head_bucket) and/or 'readwrite' (put_object, delete_object, copy_object, create_bucket, delete_bucket). Defaults to all groups.

environmentVariables.name: S3_ENABLED_TOOLS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of individual tool names to enable. Overrides group-level filtering for specific tools.

environmentVariables.name: S3_DISABLED_TOOLS
environmentVariables.description: Comma-separated list of individual tool names to disable. Applied after group and enabled-tool filtering.

environmentVariables.name: SKIP_HEALTH_CHECKS
environmentVariables.description: Skip AWS credential and bucket validation on startup.

name: io.github.chromedevtools/chrome-devtools-mcp
title: Chrome DevTools
description: Chrome browser control via DevTools for web automation, debugging, and performance analysis.

packageArguments.name: --headless
packageArguments.description: Run Chrome in headless mode (no visible browser window).

packageArguments.name: --browserUrl
packageArguments.description: URL of a running debuggable Chrome instance to connect to (e.g., http://localhost:9222).

packageArguments.name: --wsEndpoint
packageArguments.description: WebSocket endpoint URL for connecting to a Chrome instance.

packageArguments.name: --wsHeaders
packageArguments.description: Custom headers for WebSocket connection as a JSON string.

packageArguments.name: --autoConnect
packageArguments.description: Automatically connect to a running Chrome instance (requires Chrome 144+).

packageArguments.name: --isolated
packageArguments.description: Create a temporary user-data-dir that is auto-cleaned after the browser closes.

packageArguments.name: --channel
packageArguments.description: Chrome channel to use.

packageArguments.name: --executablePath
packageArguments.description: Path to a custom Chrome executable.

packageArguments.name: --viewport
packageArguments.description: Initial viewport size (e.g., 1280x720).

packageArguments.name: --proxyServer
packageArguments.description: Proxy server URL for Chrome network traffic.

packageArguments.name: --userDataDir
packageArguments.description: Path to a Chrome user data directory for persistent profiles.

packageArguments.name: --categoryEmulation
packageArguments.description: Enable emulation tool category (emulate, resize_page).

packageArguments.name: --categoryPerformance
packageArguments.description: Enable performance tool category (performance_start_trace, performance_stop_trace, performance_analyze_insight).

packageArguments.name: --categoryNetwork
packageArguments.description: Enable network tool category (list_network_requests, get_network_request).

packageArguments.name: --no-usage-statistics
packageArguments.description: Disable Google usage statistics collection.

packageArguments.name: --no-performance-crux
packageArguments.description: Disable sending URLs to Google CrUX API for field performance data.

packageArguments.name: --accept-insecure-certs
packageArguments.description: Accept insecure or self-signed TLS certificates.

packageArguments.name: --chrome-arg
packageArguments.description: Extra argument to pass to the Chrome process. Can be repeated.

packageArguments.name: --ignore-default-chrome-arg
packageArguments.description: Disable a default Chrome argument. Only applies when Chrome is launched by chrome-devtools-mcp. Can be repeated.

packageArguments.name: --log-file
packageArguments.description: Path to a log file for server output.

environmentVariables.name: CHROME_DEVTOOLS_MCP_NO_USAGE_STATISTICS
environmentVariables.description: Set to disable Google usage statistics collection. Alternative to the --no-usage-statistics flag.

environmentVariables.name: CI
environmentVariables.description: When set, disables usage statistics (same effect as CHROME_DEVTOOLS_MCP_NO_USAGE_STATISTICS).

environmentVariables.name: DEBUG
environmentVariables.description: Set to '*' to enable verbose debug logging (use with --log-file).

name: io.github.neondatabase/mcp-server-neon
title: Neon Postgres
description: Manage Neon Postgres projects, branches, databases, and run SQL queries via natural language.

packageArguments.description: Start the MCP server in stdio mode
Neon API key for authenticating API requests.

environmentVariables.name: NEON_API_KEY
environmentVariables.description: Neon API key for authenticating API requests. Alternative to passing the key as a CLI argument.

headers.name: Authorization
headers.description: Bearer token for API key authentication. Required when not using OAuth.

headers.name: x-read-only
headers.description: Set to 'true' to restrict the server to read-only operations for safe querying.

headers.name: Authorization
headers.description: Bearer token for API key authentication. Required when not using OAuth.

headers.name: x-read-only
headers.description: Set to 'true' to restrict the server to read-only operations for safe querying.
